title: Mobile Application: CURD
summary: Prompt: Western Governors University requires a mobile application that allows its student base to schdule key events. Students will create an account with a unique username and password. After creating a student account users will have the option to schdule terms, courses, and assignments. Once events are scheduled the user will be notified when upcoming events occur. Student data and schedule will be stored on a database and will be persistant.

title: Software 2: CURD w/Database
summary: Prompt: The local bicycle shop is in need of an inventory management application. This application must be able to keep a running count of inventory items.  Users can input inventory transactions into the application and when items move in and out of the inventory the count is incremented or decremented accordingly. Bikes will have parts associated with them and are tracked as individual components of the bike item.

title: Cleveland Barons Logo
summary: The Cleveland Barons Youth Hockey Organization is seeking a comprehensive design solution that will effectively represent their brand and enhance their visual identity. The organization aims to create a professional and cohesive design system that can be applied across various mediums and touchpoints, including but not limited to, digital platforms, print materials, uniforms, and merchandise.
target: The design solution should appeal primarily to parents, players, and coaches within the youth hockey community in Cleveland and the surrounding regions. The target audience consists of individuals who are passionate about hockey and value the development of young athletes both on and off the ice.
objectives: Brand Identity: Develop a modern and visually appealing logo and brand mark that embodies the spirit of the Cleveland Barons Youth Hockey Organization while reflecting its heritage and tradition.
Visual Consistency: Establish a consistent design language that can be applied consistently across different materials, ensuring a unified and recognizable visual identity.

Digital Presence: Design a user-friendly and visually engaging website that showcases the organization's programs, events, and achievements while facilitating easy navigation for parents, players, and coaches.

Print Collateral: Create a set of branded print materials, such as brochures, flyers, and banners, that effectively communicate the organization's values, programs, and events to both existing and potential members.
Uniform Design: Develop a distinctive and modern uniform design for players that incorporates the organization's logo and color scheme, while ensuring comfort and functionality.
Merchandise Design: Design a range of merchandise items, including apparel, accessories, and promotional items, that align with the organization's brand and create additional revenue streams.
guidelines: Colors: The design should incorporate the organization's current color scheme, which consists of navy blue, silver, and white. Additional accent colors may be considered to enhance visual appeal and versatility.
Typography: Select fonts that are clean, legible, and suitable for both digital and print materials. Consider a font pairing that conveys a balance between professionalism and a youthful spirit.

Imagery: Utilize high-quality action shots and imagery that capture the energy, dedication, and teamwork associated with youth hockey. Images should feature diverse groups of players to promote inclusivity.
Logo Usage: Provide clear guidelines on the usage of the organization's logo and brand mark, including variations, minimum size requirements, and clear space rules.
deliveribles: Primary logo and secondary logo/brand mark in various formats (vector, PNG, JPEG) suitable for both digital and print usage.
Brand guidelines document outlining logo usage, color palette, typography, and imagery guidelines.
Website design mockup for desktop and mobile screens, including wireframes and interactive elements.
Print collateral templates, including brochures, flyers, and banners, in print-ready formats (PDF, Adobe InDesign, or similar).
Uniform design concepts showcasing front, back, and side views, with attention to logo placement, color distribution, and player identification elements.
Merchandise design concepts for apparel and accessories, demonstrating variations such as t-shirts, hoodies, hats, and keychains
timeline: The design project is expected to be completed within 8-12 weeks from the start date. The timeline may be adjusted in consultation with the Cleveland Barons Youth Hockey Organization.
wireframe: This is a wireframe section for:
prototype: This is a prototype section for:
flowchart: This is a flowchart section for:
conclusion: This is a conclusion section for:

title: Columbus Bluejackets Re-imagine
summary: The Columbus Blue Jackets, a professional ice hockey team in the National Hockey League (NHL), are seeking a logo redesign to enhance their brand identity. The objective is to create a modern and impactful logo that represents the team's spirit, history, and connection to the city of Columbus, Ohio. The new logo should resonate with fans, evoke a sense of pride, and be versatile for various applications, including digital platforms, merchandise, and marketing collateral.
target: The target audience includes Columbus Blue Jackets fans, NHL enthusiasts, and the local community in Columbus, Ohio. The logo should resonate with both loyal supporters and attract new fans by embodying the team's values, traditions, and local pride.
objectives: Brand Representation: Develop a logo that effectively represents the Columbus Blue Jackets' brand identity, capturing the team's attributes, including strength, determination, and loyalty. The logo should reflect the team's connection to the city of Columbus and its rich hockey history.

Symbolic Elements: Incorporate symbolic elements that resonate with the team name, Blue Jackets. Explore visual representations of historical figures, icons, or imagery associated with Columbus or Ohio that embody the team's identity and uniqueness.

Visual Appeal: Create a visually appealing and modern logo that is memorable and distinctive. Consider a balance between simplicity and detail to ensure legibility and scalability across different applications and sizes.
Color Scheme: Utilize the team's existing color palette, which includes navy blue, red, and silver. Evaluate the usage of these colors to enhance the logo's visual impact, depth, and versatility.

Typography: Select suitable typography that complements the logo design and represents the team's personality. The font should be legible, balanced, and suitable for both digital and print applications.

Adaptability: Design the logo in a way that allows for easy adaptation to different mediums, including merchandise, uniforms, digital platforms, and promotional materials. Consider variations that can be used for different occasions or specific marketing campaigns.
guidelines: Colors: Utilize the team's existing color scheme of navy blue, red, and silver. Evaluate the usage of these colors in the logo design, considering their visual impact, balance, and compatibility with different backgrounds.

Typography: Select fonts that complement the logo design and reflect the team's personality. Ensure legibility and readability in different sizes and applications, including digital and print materials.
Logo Usage: Provide guidelines on logo usage, including clear space requirements, minimum size specifications, color variations, and restrictions on distortion or alteration.
deliveribles: Primary logo design in various formats (vector, PNG, JPEG) suitable for both digital and print usage.
Logo variations or alternative marks for specific use cases or promotional campaigns, ensuring consistency with the primary logo.
Color palette recommendations, specifying the colors used in the logo design and their respective Pantone, CMYK, RGB, and hexadecimal values.
Typography recommendations, including font families, weights, and sizes suitable for various applications, ensuring consistency with the logo design.
Logo usage guidelines, outlining clear space requirements, minimum size specifications, and restrictions on distortion or alteration.
Mockups or visual representations of the logo applied to different mediums, such as digital platforms, merchandise, uniforms, and promotional materials.
timeline: The design project is expected to be completed within 6-8 weeks from the start date. The timeline may be adjusted based on the complexity of the logo design and client feedback.
wireframe: This is a wireframe section for:
prototype: This is a prototype section for:
flowchart: This is a flowchart section for:

title: Here For Beer Hockey Club
summary: Here For Beer is a recreational adult league hockey team seeking a comprehensive design solution that captures the team's spirit of fun, camaraderie, and love for the game. The objective is to create a visually engaging and cohesive design system that incorporates the team name, primary color (yellow), and secondary colors (black, white, and silver) across various touchpoints, including team uniforms, merchandise, and promotional materials.
target: The design solution should primarily resonate with adult hockey players and enthusiasts, both team members and supporters, who appreciate the recreational and social aspect of the sport. Additionally, consider attracting local sponsors and fans who enjoy attending games and supporting the team.
objectives: Team Logo: Develop a distinctive and eye-catching team logo that reflects the team's name, Here For Beer, and embodies the fun and relaxed nature of recreational adult league hockey. The logo should incorporate elements that signify hockey, camaraderie, and a hint of beer-related imagery.

Team Uniform Design: Create a visually appealing and cohesive uniform design that prominently features the team logo and effectively utilizes the primary and secondary colors. Consider incorporating bold stripes, team numbers, and player names to enhance individuality and team unity.

Merchandise Design: Design a range of merchandise items, including apparel (t-shirts, hoodies, caps) and accessories (keychains, bottle openers), that feature the team logo and color scheme. The designs should appeal to team members and supporters, capturing the team's playful and spirited vibe.

Promotional Materials: Develop branded promotional materials such as banners, flyers, and social media graphics to promote team events, games, and sponsorships. Ensure consistency with the team's visual identity and create engaging designs that grab attention and generate excitement.

Typography and Graphic Elements: Select fonts and graphic elements that align with the team's personality, balancing a sense of playfulness with readability and legibility. Explore typography styles that convey energy and excitement while maintaining clarity in different applications.
guidelines: Colors: Yellow should be the primary color, representing the team's identity. Black, white, and silver should be used as secondary colors to complement the primary color. Explore shades, gradients, and combinations that create visual interest and harmony within the design system.

Typography: Select bold and legible fonts that evoke a sense of energy and enthusiasm. Consider fonts that are suitable for both headlines and body text, ensuring readability across various applications.
Imagery: Utilize hockey-related imagery, such as hockey sticks, pucks, ice rinks, and hockey players, to enhance the visual appeal and reinforce the team's connection to the sport.
Logo Usage: Provide guidelines for the team logo usage, including variations, minimum size requirements, clear space rules, and color usage (full color, grayscale, or monochrome).
deliveribles: Team logo in various formats (vector, PNG, JPEG) suitable for both digital and print usage.
Uniform design concepts showcasing front and back views, highlighting the team logo, primary color (yellow), and effective utilization of secondary colors (black, white, and silver).
Merchandise designs for apparel and accessories, including t-shirt designs, hoodies, caps, keychains, and bottle openers, featuring the team logo and color scheme.

Promotional materials, including banners, flyers, and social media graphics, to promote team events, games, and sponsorships. Designs should align with the team's visual identity and generate excitement.
Typography and graphic elements recommendations for consistent usage across various applications, including guidelines for font styles, sizes, and usage scenarios.
timeline: The design project is expected to be completed within 4-6 weeks from the start date. The timeline may be adjusted based on the complexity of the deliverables and client feedback.
wireframe: This is a wireframe section for:
prototype: This is a prototype section for:
flowchart: This is a flowchart section for:
conclusion: This is a conclusion section for:

title: Guitar Amp Sim UI
summary: Our company is a guitar amplifier simulation software company similar to Neural DSP, and we are seeking a comprehensive user interface design solution for our software product. The objective is to create a visually appealing, intuitive, and user-friendly interface that accurately represents the virtual guitar amplifiers and effects while providing an immersive experience for guitar players and enthusiasts.
target: The target audience consists of guitar players and enthusiasts of all levels of expertise, ranging from beginners to professionals. The design should cater to both casual users looking for a user-friendly experience and advanced users who demand precise control over amplifier and effect parameters.
objectives: Visual Representation: Develop a visually stunning interface that accurately replicates the look and feel of real guitar amplifiers, cabinets, and effects pedals. The design should evoke a sense of authenticity and realism to create an immersive experience for users.

Intuitive Navigation: Design an intuitive and user-friendly interface that allows guitarists to easily navigate and control various parameters and settings of the virtual amplifiers and effects. Streamline the user workflow to ensure a seamless and efficient user experience.
Responsive Design: Create a responsive interface that can adapt to different screen sizes and resolutions, ensuring optimal user experience on desktop, laptop, and mobile devices.
Customizability: Provide users with the ability to customize the interface layout, color schemes, and control assignments to suit their personal preferences and workflow.

Visual Feedback: Incorporate visual feedback mechanisms, such as animations, indicators, and visual cues, to enhance the user experience and provide clear feedback on parameter changes, active effects, and signal routing.

Preset Management: Design a robust preset management system that allows users to easily create, save, and recall their custom amplifier and effect settings. Include features such as preset naming, categorization, and sharing functionalities.

Accessibility: Ensure the interface is accessible to users with different levels of expertise and accommodate users with visual impairments by providing alternative color schemes, adjustable font sizes, and screen reader compatibility.
guidelines: Colors: The interface should align with our brand colors, which include [specify brand colors or provide guidelines for color selection]. Select additional colors that complement the brand and contribute to a visually appealing and harmonious interface.

Typography: Choose legible fonts for different interface elements, ensuring readability across various devices and screen sizes. Consider font styles that reflect the brand's personality and resonate with the guitar-playing community.

Imagery: Incorporate high-quality product images and graphics that accurately represent guitar amplifiers, cabinets, and effects pedals. Utilize visual assets that enhance the user's perception of interacting with real-world gear.
Logo Usage: Provide guidelines on the usage of our company logo, including placement, size, and clear space rules within the interface
deliveribles: Wireframes and interactive prototypes demonstrating the overall user interface layout, navigation flow, and key interactions.
High-fidelity interface designs for desktop and mobile screens, including all relevant screens and interface elements (buttons, sliders, knobs, etc.)
Iconography and graphics suitable for the interface, including amplifier and effect icons, control indicators, and visual feedback elements.
Design specifications document outlining typography, color palette, and usage guidelines for consistent implementation of the interface.
UI assets and design files in a format suitable for development handover (e.g., Sketch, Adobe XD, or Figma).
timeline: The design project is expected to be completed within 10-12 weeks from the start date. The timeline may be adjusted in consultation with our company.
wireframe: This is a wireframe section for:
prototype: This is a prototype section for:
flowchart: This is a flowchart section for:
conclusion: This is a conclusion section for:
